metadata.title: CVE-2020-15675 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
When processing surfaces, the lifetime may outlive a persistent bufferleading to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 81.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
